intro: Calytrix interstans, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, preferring sandy soils and salty air. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruit that contains seeds dispersed by wind. Calytrix interstans is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
